snippet: The Success Academy Charters Schools group’s aim to double in size by 2016 forces Mayor Bill de Blasio to choose between two troublesome options.
abstract: Success Academy Charters Schools group's attempt to double in size by 2016 forces New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio to choose between two troublesome options--hand over free space in public or private buildings to them or give schools money to find their own space; first option has frequently led to protests from parents and teachers in schools that have to share space, and second option could come with spiraling financial costs.
lead_paragraph: The Success Academy Charters Schools group’s aim to double in size by 2016 forces Mayor Bill de Blasio to choose between two troublesome options.

headline.seo: Success Academy Charter Schools Force Mayor Bill de Blasio to Confront New Law
headline.main: Success Academy’s Expansion Plans Put de Blasio in a Tough Spot
headline.print_headline: Charter School Network’s Plan for Growth Puts de Blasio in a Tough Spot
